title: Koichi Hashigaito
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Hashigaito was born in <a href="Nara%2C%20Nara">Nara</a> on March 30, 1982. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="Gamba%20Osaka">Gamba Osaka</a> in 2000. However he could not play at all in the match until 2001. In 2002, he entered <a href="Osaka%20Gakuin%20University">Osaka Gakuin University</a>. After graduating from Osaka Gakuin University, he joined newly was promoted to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club, <a href="Ehime%20FC">Ehime FC</a> in 2006. On June 2, he debuted as center back against <a href="Sagan%20Tosu">Sagan Tosu</a>. However he could only play this match. In 2007, he moved to <a href="Japanese%20Prefectural%20Leagues">Prefectural Leagues</a> club <a href="Nara%20Club">Tonan Club</a> (later "Nara Club") based in his local. In 2008, he moved to Prefectural Leagues club <a href="FC%20Tiamo%20Hirakata">FC Tiamo</a>. In November 2008, he returned to Nara Club. The club was promoted to <a href="Japanese%20Regional%20Leagues">Regional Leagues</a> from 2009. He played many matches until 2013. Although his opportunity to play decreased from 2014, the club was promoted to <a href="Japan%20Football%20League">Japan Football League</a> from 2015. He retired end of 2017 season.
